item.description:
The Wars of the Roses were civil wars for the throne of England, fought between two rival houses of the Royal House of Plantagenet: the houses of Lancaster and York (the "red" and the "white" rose, respectively). The final victory went to a Lancastrian; Henry Tudor, Earl of Richmond, who married Elizabeth of York, the daughter of the late York, King Edward IV, and founded the House of Tudor.

Also in 1638 – Swedish colonists establish the first settlement in Delaware, naming it New Sweden.

There you have it, if this isn't enough reason to go out and get together and warm our bones and spirits to mark the 20th day of Lent (half way there...) then blimey buggers with you!
item.why: In 1461 Edward of York beats Queen Margaret by exclaiming "check-matey! I'm the King of England" (IV of his kind) and also on this day in 1867, Queen V & the Funk [band] Parliament enacted the British North America Act that officially created Canada!
item.name: Aloft-y Sitz Q&A: What does the War of the Roses & Candian Bacon have in common?
